bug.author: Lecanyu
bug.description:
Hi, I have tried to visualize a labeled .json file. But the visualization result is wrong. Specifically, I labeled one image in labelme and it looks like <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30331417/34700270-e336ce14-f4a7-11e7-95e3-bb0ad95ce135.png></denchmark-link>
Then I visualized labeled json file. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30331417/34700291-0febdf8a-f4a8-11e7-8692-758d563ad1c8.png></denchmark-link>
As you can see, the legend in visualization is wrong. I guess that the error is caused by overlapped label area between water (red polygon in the first image) and lamppost (blue polygon in the first image) Is it a bug? Does this error cause wrong label id in final dataset? Any solutions will be appreciated.

comments.comment:
I think something is wrong in your environment or your annotation. And I think you can check the sanity of your annotation with sample file:
https://github.com/wkentaro/labelme/blob/master/static/apc2016_obj3.json
and utility scripts:
https://github.com/wkentaro/labelme/blob/master/scripts/labelme_draw_json https://github.com/wkentaro/labelme/blob/master/scripts/labelme_json_to_dataset
Maybe you should try below: ./labelme_draw_json ../static/apc2016_obj3.json ./labelme_draw_json <your json file>
# check what is different labelme ../static/apc2016_obj3.json labelme <your json file> less ../static/apc2016_obj3.json less <your json file>

Hi, I have tried your sample file by your scripts and my installed scripts. They produce the same result. your sample file looks like <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30331417/34793320-9259da1c-f610-11e7-9533-f820be47e6aa.png></denchmark-link>
In labelme. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30331417/34793430-f199d7c0-f610-11e7-9db4-690750f8a686.png></denchmark-link>
They look like good. However, your scripts and my installed scripts don't work in my json file. You can try it in <denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/open?id=1J3_cr5dL6OKnc6skP9p4pqukeqx7QSuw>this link</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Lecanyu>@Lecanyu</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wkentaro/labelme/pull/59>#59</denchmark-link> fixes this issue, and I got the result below. Does this look okay for you? <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4310419/35700962-d882cc78-07d7-11e8-9917-a2318a3bde62.png></denchmark-link>
Yes. I think it works normally now. Did you upload you newest code?
Yeah, Please use the current master branch.
